faqs.question: Hvor mye koster denne eiendommen?
faqs.answer: €100,000. This 2-bedroom apartment is priced 13% below the Avileses market average of €2,200 per square meter, positioning it as exceptional value. Flexible payment terms and international financing options are available through specialized lenders.

faqs.question: Kan utlendinger kjøpe eiendom i Spania?
faqs.answer: Yes. Non-EU citizens can purchase property in Spain without restrictions, requiring only a Spanish tax identification number (NIE) and completion of property registration. The process typically takes 4-6 weeks with appropriate legal representation. British, American, and other international buyers regularly purchase Spanish properties.

faqs.question: Hva koster det å kjøpe eiendom i Spania?
faqs.answer: Additional costs total approximately 7-10% of purchase price. Stamp duty ranges 6-10%, notary and registration fees typically €800-1,500, and legal fees average €1,000-2,000. Professional surveying and property inspection add €300-600. These costs are standard across Spanish property transactions.

faqs.question: How much rental income can this property generate?
faqs.answer: This 2-bedroom apartment typically commands €800 per week for holiday lets in Avileses, generating approximately €41,600 annual gross revenue at 65% occupancy. After property taxes, management fees (typically 20-25%), maintenance, and insurance, net yields typically reach 5-7% - competitive with alternative European real estate investments.

faqs.question: Er Costa Blanca et godt sted å kjøpe eiendom?
faqs.answer: Yes. Costa Blanca demonstrates documented 8% year-on-year appreciation, established expatriate communities, and consistent tourism demand supporting holiday rental income. The region offers significantly lower entry prices than island markets while maintaining equivalent tourist appeal and infrastructure quality.

faqs.question: Hva er levekostnadene på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Cost of living in Avileses averages 20-30% lower than UK equivalents. Rental expenses, grocery costs, and dining remain particularly affordable. Utilities typically cost €100-150 monthly, groceries 30% less than UK prices, and dining out remains economical through traditional Spanish restaurants.

faqs.question: Kan jeg få boliglån i Spania som utlending?
faqs.answer: Yes. International lenders offer mortgages covering 60-80% of property value to foreign buyers. Typical interest rates range 2.5-4% with 15-30 year terms. British and American buyers commonly obtain Spanish mortgages, though some prefer purchasing outright at these price points.

faqs.question: What are the property taxes in Spain?
faqs.answer: Annual property tax (IBI) averages 0.4-0.8% of registered property value, typically €200-400 annually for this property. Rental income tax applies at graduated rates from 19-45%, though legitimate deductions for management, maintenance, and depreciation significantly reduce taxable income.

faqs.question: Hvor langt er det fra Norge til Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Direct flights from UK airports to Alicante take 2-2.5 hours. Alicante-Elche Airport, Spain's busiest, sits 85 kilometers from Avileses with hourly bus service. Multiple daily flights from UK major cities make regular UK visits convenient and affordable.

faqs.question: Hvordan er været på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Over 300 days of annual sunshine with average temperatures of 17°C winter and 28°C summer. Mediterranean climate provides pleasant year-round conditions supporting both permanent residence and holiday tourism. Rainfall remains minimal, concentrated in autumn months.
